intro: Paraphlomis gracilis var. lutienensis, commonly known as the Lutien narrowleaf parflomis, is a rare variant native to specific regions in China. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and delicate floral structures. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountainous forests or wetlands. Its botanical features include small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in spikes, which bloom during the summer months. This variant is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
